physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Trigonocephaly, flat nose bridge, small upturned nose, cleft palate and lip, micrognathia, bilateral radial defects and club hands, pes equinovarus, and hypospadias. Ocular examination revealed bilateral vascularized dome-shaped corneal tumors, distinctly larger on the right side, protruding through the right palpebral fissure. The tumors were opaque salmon-colored and felt soft and cystic on palpation. The limbus was spared in both eyes.
Both corneal dermoids, particularly the right corneal tumor, had regressed significantly. Posterior segment findings were stable.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No progression in corneal tumors observed during the visits in 2017 and 2019, with significant regression noted by the most recent visit in June 2021.
